Evaluate: CLASS data archive/access requirements (Comprehensive Large Array Stewardship System) – CLASS is expected to be evolve into the preferred architecture for all NOAA data archive
Evaluate: CLASS data archive/access requirements (Comprehensive
Large Array Stewardship System)
– CLASS is expected to be evolve into the preferred architecture for all NOAA data archive

and access systems
and access systems

– All NOAA Goals rely on data that will be within the CLASS data environment
– All NOAA Goals rely on data that will be within the CLASS data environment

• CLASS will provide the storage, archive, and access to large-array data sets:
• CLASS will provide the storage, archive, and access to large-array data sets:

– Satellite (POES, DMSP, GOES, EOS-MODIS, NPOESS, NPP, Metop) – Radar (NEXRAD and future dual polarized and phased-array radars) – Model Data Sets (Weather and Climate) – Provide access to smaller scale ancillary data sets that are essential for these large array
– Satellite (POES, DMSP, GOES, EOS-MODIS, NPOESS, NPP, Metop)
– Radar (NEXRAD and future dual polarized and phased-array radars)

management principles
management principles

Data Management consists of two major activities conducted in coordination: data management services and data stewardship. They constitute a comprehensive end-to- end process including movement of data and information from the observing system sensors to the data user. This process includes the acquisition, quality control, metadata cataloging, validation, reprocessing, storage, retrieval, dissemination, and archival of data.
